importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date when Aryeh Zalmanovich is believed to have been killed in captivity.
The date the US-proposed ceasefire deal was signed, triggering the obligation for Hamas to return hostages.
The date on which the two deceased hostages were returned to Israel.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeframe Hamas was supposed to return all deceased hostages under the ceasefire agreement, including within the first 72 hours of its implementation.

keyTakeAways: Hamas returned two deceased Israeli hostages to Israel under the US-proposed ceasefire agreement, marking the 14th and 15th such transfers since October 9.
The first identified deceased hostage is Aryeh Zalmanovich, an 85-year-old man abducted alive from his home and believed to have died on November 17, 2023.
The identity of the second deceased hostage has not been publicly released, though their family has been notified.
Israeli authorities have raised concerns that Hamas may not be able to locate and return all remaining dead hostages due to rubble and logistical challenges.
Hamas has stated that significant efforts and special equipment are needed to recover bodies in Gaza, and one prior body was reportedly misidentified.
The US Vice President, JD Vance, visited Israel and emphasized the importance of retrieving all deceased hostages, while noting the difficulty and that this process will not happen overnight.
The Biden administration and Israel are working to uphold the ceasefire deal, though tensions remain due to mutual accusations of violations.

namedEntities.name: Aryeh Zalmanovich
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is one of the two deceased hostages identified by Israeli authorities and is central to the narrative of hostage recovery and the human cost of the conflict.

namedEntities.name: Hamas
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hamas is responsible for the abduction of hostages and is now under obligation to return them, including the deceased, under the ceasefire agreement.

namedEntities.name: Israel Defense Forces (IDF)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The IDF is responsible for identifying the remains, assessing the situation, and enforcing the ceasefire terms regarding hostage returns.

namedEntities.name: United States (Trump administration)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The US proposed and signed the ceasefire deal, creating the legal and diplomatic framework for hostage returns and ceasefire enforcement.

namedEntities.name: JD Vance
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He visited Israel and publicly addressed the challenges of recovering deceased hostages, reinforcing US involvement in the ceasefire effort.

namedEntities.name: National Institute for Forensic Medicine
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: This institution is where the remains of the deceased hostages were taken for identification and post-mortem investigation.

namedEntities.name: Ceasefire deal (US-proposed)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The agreement mandates Hamas to return all deceased hostages within a strict timeframe, forming the basis of the current hostage recovery efforts.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Under the US-proposed ceasefire deal signed on October 9, 2025, Hamas has returned two deceased Israeli hostages to Israel. Israeli authorities have identified one as Aryeh Zalmanovich, an 85-year-old man believed to have been killed in captivity on November 17, 2023. The identity of the second hostage has not been released, though their family has been informed. The Israeli Defense Forces have emphasized the difficulty of recovery due to rubble and Hamasâ€™s limited capacity, and have noted that one prior body was misidentified. US Vice President JD Vance visited Israel and affirmed the importance of retrieving all deceased hostages, acknowledging the challenges but stressing that the process will not happen overnight. This development marks the 14th and 15th deceased hostages to be returned since the ceasefire began.
title: Israel Identifies One of Two Deceased Hostages Returned by Hamas
